intro: Dichapetalum unguiculatum, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by distinctive, elongated fruits that split open to release seeds. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along riverbanks. The plant has been used traditionally for its latex, which can be toxic and has been utilized in various medicinal and cultural practices.
